summary: The Rural Broadband Modernization Act aims to expand broadband access in rural areas. It authorizes grants, loans, and loan guarantees to facilitate the construction, improvement, and acquisition of broadband infrastructure. The bill sets minimum speed requirements (100 Mbps symmetrical), prioritizes projects in unserved areas, and outlines eligibility criteria for entities and projects. It also addresses application processes, grant amounts, loan terms, and funding allocation, aiming to promote high-quality broadband service in rural communities and modernize the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.
